required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Real-world Evaluation of Prevalence of Ocular Adverse Events in Patients With Neovascular (Wet) Agerelated Macular Degeneration (AMD) Who Received Anti-VEGF Agents (IRIS Registry)
clinical_study.official_title: Real-world Evaluation of Prevalence of Ocular Adverse Events in Patients With Neovascular (Wet) Agerelated Macular Degeneration (AMD) Who Received Anti-VEGF Agents (IRIS Registry)

brief_summary.textblock: In this cross-sectional study of patients with wet AMD who received ≥1 anti-VEGF injection (excluding brolucizumab), evidence was generated to describe the period prevalence of specific ocular AEs. The study was conducted using the IRIS Registry, and all results were based on the study period from 01/01/2019 to 12/31/2019.

detailed_description.textblock:
This was a retrospective cohort study of eyes in adult patients with a diagnosis of wet AMD who were treated with anti-VEGF agents from 01/01/2019 to 12/31/2019.
IRIS Registry data from 01/01/2019 to 12/31/2019 for patients with a diagnosis of wet AMD who were treated with ≥1 anti-VEGF agent (excluding brolucizumab) were included.
- Identification period: Patients fulfilling the selection criteria during the period from 01/01/2019 to 12/31/2019 were identified
- Index date: 01/01/2019
- Study Period: 01/01/2019 to 12/31/2019
- Pre-index period: 01/01/2018 to 12/31/2018
- Post-index period: 01/01/2019 to 12/31/2019

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with Intraocular Inflammation (IOI) Adverse events (AEs) who were treated with anti-VEGF agents
primary_outcome.time_frame: earliest claim of anti-VEGF injection over a one-year period from 01/012019 to 31/12/2019
primary_outcome.description: Period prevalence of IOI in patients with wet AMD who were treated with anti- VEGF agents (excluding brolucizumab) over a one-year period in 2019 was assessed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: earliest claim of anti-VEGF injection over a one-year period from 01/012019 to 31/12/2019
earliest claim of anti-VEGF injection over a one-year period from 01/012019 to 31/12/2019

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients at various Patient Region
secondary_outcome.time_frame: earliest claim of anti-VEGF injection over a one-year period from 01/012019 to 31/12/2019
secondary_outcome.description: Patient regions: Northeast, Midwest, South, West, Unknown

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with Insurance type
secondary_outcome.time_frame: earliest claim of anti-VEGF injection over a one-year period from 01/012019 to 31/12/2019
secondary_outcome.description: Private, Medicare, Medicare Advantage, Medicaid, Other

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with Laterality of wet Age-related macular degeneration (AMD)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Index date (defined as the date of first injection - 01/01/2019)
secondary_outcome.description: Laterality of wet AMD: Unilateral, Bilateral

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patient eyes with the Provider specialty on date of first anti-VEGF injection
secondary_outcome.time_frame: earliest claim of anti-VEGF injection over a one-year period from 01/012019 to 31/12/2019
secondary_outcome.description: The following types were included: Retina specialist, General ophthalmologist

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patient eyes treated with anti-VEGF agent
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Index date (defined as the date of first injection - 01/01/2019)
secondary_outcome.description: The following types were included OD [eye, right], OS [eye, left], Unspecified

secondary_outcome.time_frame: over a one-year period from 01/012019 to 31/12/2019
secondary_outcome.description: Anti-VEGF utilization in patients with wet AMD who were treated with anti- VEGF agents (excluding brolucizumab) over a one-year period was assessed. Measured at the patient level and patient-eye level.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with other ocular AEs in patients with wet AMD who were treated with anti-VEGF agents (excluding brolucizumab)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: over a one-year period from 01/012019 to 31/12/2019
secondary_outcome.description: The following types were included: Key ocular AEs IOI events RVO events Unspecified RO Autoimmune disorders (systemic lupus erythematosus [SLE], Behcet's disease, sarcoidosis, VKH disease, HLA-B27 syndromes, Drug hypersensitivity) RV without RO (RAO and/or RVO)

arm_group.description: Patients/patient eyes who were treated only with aflibercept in 2019
Patients/patient eyes who were treated only with ranibizumab in 2019
Patients/patient eyes who were treated only with bevacizumab in 2019
Patients/patient eyes who were treated with ≥2 different anti-VEGFs in 2019

study_pop.textblock: IRIS Registry data from 01/01/2019 to 12/31/2019 for patients with a diagnosis of wet AMD who were treated with ≥1 anti-VEGF agent (excluding brolucizumab) were included.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ≥1 International Classification of Diseases, Clinical Modification-9/10 CM (ICD- 9/10) code for wet AMD in 2019
- ≥1 Healthcare Common Procedure Coding System (HCPCS) code (J code) or National Drug Code (NDC) code for treatment with an anti-VEGF agent (excluding brolucizumab) in 2019
- ≥18 years old in 2019
- ≥2 wet AMD-related office visits in 2019
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient eyes that received >1 type of anti-VEGF treatment on the same date
- Patient eyes that did not have laterality any time during 2018-2019
- Treatment with brolucizumab during 2019
